maqras.text: Glorify the name of your Fosterer, the Most High
Who created then set the equilibrium
and Who programmed then guided (to the programme)
And Who brought forth the pasture
then made it dust coloured rubbish
We will make you recite, so that you will not forget
except that which Allah wills, He certainly knows the manifest and (also) that which is hidden
And We will make your (way) easy for the easy (way)
So remind, if reminding is profitable
he who fears will be reminded
and he who is unfortunate will turn away from it
he who will enter the great fire
then he will neither die therein nor live
He succeeds who purifies himself
and remembers the name of his Fosterer, then worships (offers salat)
No, you prefer the life of this world
while the hereafter is better and that which remains
This is certainly there in the earlier books (too)
books of lbrahim and Musa
Have the details of the happenings on the (day of the final) covering come to you
Faces on that day will be downcast
labouring, weary
entering very hot fire
being made to drink from boiling spring
There will be no food for them except that from the thorn tree
It will neither be nourishable by them nor will it make them free from hunger
(Other) faces that day will be happy
pleased on account of the effort they had put in earlier
(They will be) in a high garden
therein you will not hear useless talk
therein is a flowing spring
therein are raised couches
and drinking cups placed ready (for use)
and cushions set in rows
and carpets spread
So do they not see towards the camel how it is created
and towards the sky how it is raised
and towards the mountains how they are rooted
and towards the earth how it is spread
So remind, you are only to remind
You are not in authority over them
But one who turns away and does not believe
so he will be punished by Allah with a great punishment
Their return is certainly towards Us
then certainly, it is on Us to take their account
By the dawn
and the ten nights
and the even and the odd
and the night when it travels
For one who has sense, these (items) are surely worth being sworn by
Did you not see how your Fosterer dealt with Aad
people of Iram, possessors of (lofty buildings supported by) pillars
the like of which was not created in (other) cities
and Samood who cut the rocks in the valley
and Firawn, possessor of pegs
who rebelled in the cities
Thus they increased corruption in them
So your Fosterer poured on them a portion of the punishment
Your Fosterer is certainly watchfully waiting
So as for man, whenever his Fosterer tries him by honouring him and favouring him, then he says, “My Fosterer has honoured me.”
And as for (the situation) when He tries him by straitening on him his provision, he says, “My Fosterer has disgraced me.”
No, but the orphan is not honoured by you
and you do not urge one another on the feeding of the poor
and you eat off the inheritance, eating it greedily
and you love wealth with intense love
No, when the earth is crushed to level it in a level
and your Fosterer comes with the angels in rank after rank
so on that day, hell will be brought near, (and) on that day man will be mindful. But his being mindful (on that day) will be of no use to him
He will say, "I wish I had sent (good deeds) before, for my life (after death)
So on that day, no one’s punishment will be like His punishment
and no one's binding will be like His binding
O you peaceful soul
Return to your Fosterer pleased and pleasing (Him)
so enter among My servants
and enter My garden
